biography: Viennese born, Friedrich "Fritz" Werner was primarily known as a portraitist although he also painted landscapes. Werner studied at the Vienna Imperial Academy, the National Academy of Fine Arts in Munich, and Académie des Beaux-Arts in Paris. In 1932, he came to Los Angeles after working for several years in Argentina. Later, he later maintained studios in Woodstock, New York and Chandler, Arizona, and settled finally in La Jolla, California. Werner's work is found in the collections of the Ohio Supreme Court, the Montpelier (VT) State House, the University of Cincinnati, Northwestern University (Chicago); and the San Diego Museum.
